p: Active compounds in highest concentrations in basil EO were eugenol, linalool, estragole and methyl cinnamate, while active compounds in lavender were lavandulyl acetate, octacosane, and eugenol; black seeds characteristic by Limonene and 9, 12 Octadecadienoic acid active compounds. Eugenol active compound had repellent activity against Ixodes ricinus [ 55]. The estragole active compound had insecticide and pesticide activity against stored Vigna pest ( Callosobruchus maculatus) [ 56]. Presences of estragole and t-anethole compounds in essential oil were an indicator for insecticide characters for this EO which had antimicrobial activity [ 57].
